byline.contributor: Sabrina Tavernise contributed reporting from Washington.

abstract: Trial starts for Hughie Elbert Stover, former security chief at Upper Big Branch coal mine in West Virginia, where 29 workers died in 2010 explosion; prosecutors allege he lied to federal agents about safety violations at mine.
snippet: In an unusual case for the mining industry, an official at the Upper Big Branch mine is charged with lying to investigators in the aftermath of the explosion there that caused 29 deaths.
lead_paragraph: In an unusual case for the mining industry, an official at the Upper Big Branch mine is charged with lying to investigators in the aftermath of the explosion there that caused 29 deaths.

headline.main: Trial Starts for Chief of Security at Mine
headline.print_headline: Trial Starts For Chief Of Security At Mine
